text:
We all know him, this famous guy on Fortnite
or on any competitive game, against

who you fight and who takes defeat
a little too much to heart ... What will it do that

will make you insult you of all
names, to make you a little emotional sign

and to tell you that he knows your IP
and will come to see you with his gipsy pals
history of making castagne.

Well already it is unlikely that this person
really know your IP, but if it was

really the case, is it the latter
can REALLY betray you?

Hi it's Leo from the TechMaker chain
and today, in partnership with NordVPN,

we will talk about this extremely vast subject
what is the IP address, for Internet Protocol

To begin, we will try to see what
match all these numbers.

Already, a first thing that can be noticed,
is that this address is constituted
of 4 numbers, separated by dots.

The second thing you can notice is
that these numbers never exceed 255.

If you know a little bit about computers,
you may notice that this value

is not insignificant: it is the value
maximum of a number encoded on one byte.

In other words, this address is actually composed
4 bytes, and when you want to display it

we just translate the values ​​of these bytes
in decimal and they are separated by dots.

If we want to go a little further, we can
also note that an IP address is always

associated with what is called a mask
subnet, which allow the creation

groups of addresses, independent
each other.

The mask is actually used to know which part
IP defines the subnet and what

part sets the address in that same
subnet.

In short, it's not just numbers chosen
at random.

And here I already see some of
you tell me "Yeah but no, it's not

true, me my ip it looks like that, so
what you say is wrong and all "

And what you say is true! Finally for
the part that says your IP looks like

that's it, the rest we forget!
And it's actually for a simple reason

: What I told you just before applies
to what are called IPv4 addresses.

In the case just shown, this is
an IPv6.

Why we do not have one or the other
? Well, it should be, and that's not enough

just what we are aiming for ... IPv4 disappears
slowly but surely in favor of IPv6.

And the reason is simple: With the 4
bytes that make up an IPv4 address, one

has a total of 4,294,967,295 different values
possible.

As a reminder, we are not far from 2x that on
earth, so here I think I have not
need to say more.

Yet know that even if that's the reason
the most highlighted, it's far from being

the only advantage of the v6 against the v4, with
among other advantages in terms of security,
ease of implementation, etc.

And for those who wonder why not
IPv5, well, that's good, you're

curious, never stop learning,
and then well it turns out that IPv5

is something that has existed but
had nothing to do with the IP protocol,

it was a flow management protocol
developed in the year 80, which then
disappeared for the benefit of something else.
So we go directly to IPv6.

Besides, you may say that
the v5 is old, but know that IPv4

which is still predominantly used today
in 2019 is not better because it has been

developed at the same time! Yes yes, the
IP protocol that we use all the
days to nearly 40 years.

But suddenly, if someone has your
IP, is it good, it knows your

name, first name, date of birth and nickname
what did your mom give you when you got
8 years ? Maybe not anyway.

Concretely what can be done with your
IP is knowing where you already live

! But in an approximate way ... Indeed
at best it will be your neighborhood that will be given,
as well as your ISP.

So unless you're in a village of
15 people and to be the only person

at Free, not too much risk to see him land
with friends at home.

By cons it can happen a few things
in lines.

There is in particular the famous Ddos that one
knows so well, which will consist of sending

a lot of requests to the same server,
and to do that, it is enough to know
the destination IP address.

This is often what is used to put
endangered a site, and that's ultimately exactly

the same as when a big streamer
or youtuber shares the address of a small

website; the charge is too high, and so
the server has trouble handling all requests

arriving at once, which creates a big
traffic jam.

So ok, you probably do not host
no website from your own connection
Internet.

But does that mean you do not have
nothing to fear from such an attack? Not

really ... Because in itself, it is also possible
to saturate your connection,

and to make sure that you will not
more top 1 of the day!

Indeed, it is relatively common that
see this stuff happen in the world
online game.
And all that is thanks to your IP!

But now that we have become an expert
of the IP, we are entitled to ask ourselves

question: what if we do not want that
anyone can access this data

? How can we protect ourselves
?

Already, first thing, is it really necessary
? Because it's nice to say that we

found your IP, but already there are good
chances for it to be simply

not true, but then even if it was
the case, the chances for the person to pass

actually to the next step which is
the attack is really unlikely.

But the problem is that it remains simple
to carry out this kind of attack, no matter
who can do it for a few sous.

And get your IP too that can be pretty
easy.

I'll give you an example: There are some
years, a friend's brother was

scammed by a guy who was supposed to him
buy items on an online game.

The message exchanges were done by
a forum then by Skype.

The guy sends the money on Paypal, my
buddy sends the objects in the game, everything is

goes well, until 2 days later where
my friend receives an email from PayPal telling him

that the transaction was canceled because the
used account had been hacked.

And impossible to litigate or I know
not what, because PayPal only protects sales

of material objects, but here it was
of objects in a game then it's dead.

So already thanks PayPal, guys have a
cardboard safety and make it pay to

honest workers who spend their days
to farm to sell stuff, bravo, but
for now zero report with the IP.

Yet, there is one detail that is important
in history.

Among all the means used, there would be
had several ways to recover IP
saligo.

First, it would be through
of the forum used for the first exchanges.

The forum in question knows the IP of people
who post, in the same way as anyone

which site you visit may know
your IP.

Except that here, the directors would not have
surely not collaborated unless there

forced by the police, and do you
you see go to the cops yeah mode

I was robbed of my gobball pano on Dofus,
help me please
In short, we forget.

The second possibility, it would have been
by the game

We know the name of the character of the hustler
as well as the server on which it is located,

the game probably records all
connections made with date, time and
IP used.

But as for the forum, without being forced,
they certainly would not have helped us.

I'm not even sure they would have
the right to give us this info if they
wanted.
In short, the 3rd solution was the right one: Skype.

You may not know it, but it is
very simple to find the IP address of

someone only through his nickname
Skype, not even need to have him as a friend
or I do not know what.

There are sites on the internet where
we enter the nickname, and that gives us the address
IP.

With this address in our hands, we can
then go to other sites that are going

to be able to give us the location
approximate of the box to which is associated
this IP.

What we actually get is the address
from where the line is connected,

what is called a dislam!
Well in the end the guy in question was living

to Strasbourg, and how far it is
that we had not managed to chopper a lot

more info sure, like we had a name
and a street but we were absolutely not

sure, so it did not go any further,
to say that the guy was lucky,

120 € of stuff gratos pépouze ... But we
still felt a bit in fashion

detective Pikachu for a few days
!

And I'm sure with a little more money,
we could have found what we were looking for.

In other words, your IP address is not
just numbers, and you do not feel like
that you bother with that.

But then, how do you do it if you want to be
sure nobody will be able to access it

The most basic solution and also the most
effective is using a VPN or Proxy

! Thanks to these, everything you
done on the internet will be done through an intermediary.

Basically it means that if we go back this
IP, we will end up at the VPN or the proxy

in question, and unless the latter
starts to cafter, it is not possible
to make the link.

However, I advise you to leave
on the VPN, which will certainly pay a lot

unlike the Proxy who will have more luck
to be free but the problem of the second

is that your connection will not be encrypted,
and in addition unless you are sure of the provider

in question, well you can not really
know what's going on in your back ...

Finally that's valid also for VPN,
that's why I've always told you

advised not to do anything critical in

There are many other solutions but
which will be more situational depending

The thing is, here it will be useful

And the same in the other way! And these servers

So as much to tell you as you can say

! And what about our good old managers
some controversial downloads,

the ports used by these are
blocked by most TOR nodes so
here too, it will have to go his way.

Anyway, if the IP of your box
has been discovered, it is very often impossible

to modify it: at the time, our box
had what's called a dynamic IP address,
as opposed to a static IP address.

I do not think I need you
do drawing, but lo and behold, basically

a static IP your address is reserved for you,
a bit like your house address, so

that in the case of a dynamic address,
the latter may change, for example

when you unplug and reconnect your
box!

Except now, we all have static IP,
and that's a good thing for some

reasons, but it's true that sometimes

! And unless you change the operator for
you have a new address,
it may be complicated!
